intro: Koeleria dubjanskyi, commonly known as the Dubjansky's grass, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the禾本科 (Poaceae) family, which includes grasses and cereal crops. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny blue to purple flowers. It typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Koeleria dubjanskyi is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
